Multiple Facebook posts warning against: Metro, and Loblaws, claiming they are dipped in a solution of water and chlorine.
Statements from food science experts: such as Dr. Olga Padilla-Zakour and Dr. Elliot Ryser, affirming the safety and effectiveness of chlorine as a sanitizer in food processing.
Confirmation from the Canadian Food Insp: CFIA) that chlorinated wash water is used on various ready-to-eat, fresh-cut fruits and vegetables to reduce microbial load.
Clarification from Bolthouse Farms: a supplier of cocktail carrots, that the amount of chlorine in the carrot wash water is within CFIA limits and comparable to levels found in tap or drinking water.
